The '''Ball State Cardinals men's basketball''' team is the basketball team that represent [[Ball State University]] in [[Muncie, Indiana|Muncie]], [[Indiana]]. The Cardinals first basketball season was 1920-1921. The school's team currently competes in the [[Mid-American Conference]]. The team last played in the [[NCAA Division I Men's Basketball Tournament]] in [[2000 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|2000]]. The Cardinals head coach is [[Billy Taylor (basketball)|Billy Taylor]]. He became head coach when former coach [[Ronny Thompson]] resigned after one season. The team's colors are cardinal and white.<ref>[http://ballstatesports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?&DB_OEM_ID=14200&ATCLID=713009&SPID=6776&SPSID=62090 Ball State Basketball Quick Facts]</ref>
==NCAA Tournament Results==
The Cardinals have appeared in seven [[NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Championship|NCAA Tournaments]]. Their combined record is 3-7. Their most successful year was 1990, when they made the Sweet Sixteen, where they lost to eventual national champion [[UNLV Runnin' Rebels basketball|UNLV]] 69-67.
